Class DNS

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.network.DNS
All Implemented Interfaces:
CallableOnDNS, Serializable, Remote
public class DNS extends UnicastRemoteObject implements CallableOnDNS
Domain Name Service (DNS) server implementation for managing distributed game sessions. This class serves as the central registry and coordinator for game instances and client connections in a distributed gaming environment. It handles both RMI and Socket-based network protocols, manages game lifecycle operations, and coordinates communication between clients and game controllers. The DNS maintains thread-safe mappings of games to controllers, clients to their controllers, and clients to their active games. It provides services for game creation, player registration, game discovery, and connection management with built-in ping-pong mechanisms for connection monitoring.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Your development team
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • gameControllers

      public static final Map<String,GameController> gameControllers

  • Constructor Details

    • DNS

      public DNS() throws RemoteException
      Constructs a new DNS server instance. Initializes the remote object capabilities required for RMI communication and prepares the internal data structures for managing games and clients.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an error occurs during remote object initialization

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws RemoteException
      Main entry point for the DNS server application. Parses command line arguments for server IP configuration, initializes the DNS service, and starts both Socket and RMI network protocol threads. The server listens on both protocols simultaneously to support different client connection types.
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments; supports "-ip [address]" to specify server IP address. If not provided, defaults to "localhost"
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an error occurs during DNS server initialization

    • getGameControllers

      public static Map<String,GameController> getGameControllers()
      Returns the thread-safe map of all active game controllers. Provides access to the central registry of game instances managed by this DNS server. The returned map is concurrent and can be safely accessed by multiple threads.
      Returns:
      a ConcurrentHashMap mapping game IDs to their corresponding GameController instances

    • getClients

      public Map<String,CallableOnClientController> getClients()
      Returns the map of registered client controllers. Provides access to all currently connected clients and their associated controller interfaces. This map is used for direct communication with clients and connection management.
      Returns:
      a map of client nicknames to their CallableOnClientController instances

    • getClientGame

      public Map<String,GameController> getClientGame()
      Returns the map of clients to their active games. Tracks which clients are currently participating in which games, enabling proper game state management and client-game association tracking.
      Returns:
      a map of client nicknames to their associated GameController instances

    • getGameInfo

      public GameInfo getGameInfo(String gameId) throws RemoteException
      Retrieves game information for the specified game ID. Provides access to game metadata and current state information through the associated game controller.
      Specified by:
      getGameInfo in interface CallableOnDNS
      Parameters:
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game
      Returns:
      the GameInfo object containing game details and current state
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the game ID is not found or a network error occurs

    • getController

      public GameController getController(String gameId) throws RemoteException
      Retrieves the game controller for the specified game ID. Provides direct access to the controller managing the game instance, enabling advanced game operations and state manipulation.
      Specified by:
      getController in interface CallableOnDNS
      Parameters:
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game
      Returns:
      the GameController instance managing the specified game
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the game ID is not found or a network error occurs

    • registerWithNickname

      public boolean registerWithNickname(String nickname, CallableOnClientController controller) throws RemoteException
      Registers a new client with the specified nickname and controller interface. Attempts to register the client in the system, starts ping-pong monitoring for connection health, and notifies the client of available games. Registration fails if the nickname is already in use.
      Specified by:
      registerWithNickname in interface CallableOnDNS
      Parameters:
      nickname - the desired nickname for the client; must be unique
      controller - the client controller interface for bidirectional communication
      Returns:
      true if registration succeeds, false if the nickname is already taken
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a network communication error occurs during registration

    • handleDisconnection

      public void handleDisconnection(String nickname)
      Handles client disconnection and performs comprehensive cleanup. Removes the client from all internal mappings, notifies other players in the same game about the disconnection, stops ping-pong monitoring, and cleans up the entire game if necessary. This method is synchronized to prevent race conditions during cleanup.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the disconnecting client

    • getAvailableGames

      public List<GameInfo> getAvailableGames()
      Retrieves the list of games available for joining. Returns games that are not yet started and not at maximum capacity. The list is generated from the thread-safe game controllers map and reflects the current state of available games.
      Returns:
      a list of GameInfo objects representing joinable games

    • createGame

      public GameInfo createGame(PlayerColor color, int numPlayers, boolean isTestFlight, String nickname) throws RemoteException
      Creates a new game with the specified parameters and adds the creator as the first player. Validates the client registration and player count, generates a unique game ID, creates the game controller, and notifies all waiting clients about the new game. The game starts automatically when it reaches maximum capacity.
      Specified by:
      createGame in interface CallableOnDNS
      Parameters:
      color - the player color chosen by the game creator
      numPlayers - the maximum number of players for the game; must be between 2 and 4
      isTestFlight - whether this game is in test flight mode with different rules
      nickname - the nickname of the client creating the game
      Returns:
      the GameInfo object of the newly created game
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the client is not registered, player count is invalid, or a network error occurs

    • removeGame

      public void removeGame(String gameId)
      Removes a game from the active games registry. Cleans up the game controller mapping and notifies all waiting clients about the updated list of available games.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game to remove

    • pingToClientFromServer

      public void pingToClientFromServer(String nickname) throws IOException
      Sends a ping message from the server to the specified client. This method is part of the keep-alive mechanism to monitor client connectivity. If the client is not found, the ping is silently ignored.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the client to ping
      Throws:
      IOException - if a network communication error occurs during ping transmission

    • pongToServerFromClient

      public void pongToServerFromClient(String nickname) throws IOException
      Handles pong responses received from clients. Resets the timeout counter for the client and sets up disconnection handling if the client fails to respond to future pings. This method is part of the bidirectional keep-alive mechanism.
      Specified by:
      pongToServerFromClient in interface CallableOnDNS
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the client sending the pong response
      Throws:
      IOException - if a network communication error occurs

    • pingToServerFromClient

      public void pingToServerFromClient(String nickname) throws IOException
      Handles ping messages received from clients. Responds with a pong message to maintain the bidirectional keep-alive mechanism. If the client is not found, the ping is silently ignored.
      Specified by:
      pingToServerFromClient in interface CallableOnDNS
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the client that sent the ping
      Throws:
      IOException - if a network communication error occurs during pong response

    • leaveGameBeforeCreation

      public void leaveGameBeforeCreation(String nickname)
      Handles client disconnection before game creation. Delegates to the main disconnection handler to perform cleanup operations for clients who disconnect while browsing available games.
      Specified by:
      leaveGameBeforeCreation in interface CallableOnDNS
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the client leaving before creating or joining a game

    • joinGame

      public boolean joinGame(String gameId, String nickname, PlayerColor color) throws IOException
      Attempts to add a client to an existing game with the specified color. Validates client registration, game existence, game state, and color availability. If successful, adds the player to the game, notifies other players, and starts the game automatically if it reaches maximum capacity.
      Specified by:
      joinGame in interface CallableOnDNS
      Parameters:
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game to join
      nickname - the nickname of the client attempting to join
      color - the desired player color for the joining client
      Returns:
      true if the join operation succeeds, false if the color is unavailable
      Throws:
      IOException - if the client is not registered, game doesn't exist, game is started/full, or the client is already in the game
